content: {{knowledge objective |Identifiant=OIC-024-24-A |Item_parent=Main complications of pregnancy. |Item_parent_short=Main complications of pregnancy. |Rank=A |Title=Knowing the work-up for fever during pregnancy |Description=Biologies and complementary examinations according to clinical examination |Rubric=Positive diagnosis |Contributors=Paul Berveiller,Philippe Deruelle |Order=24}} In all cases, we will carry out : - ECBU - ''NFS - CRP - blood cultures (if fever > 38.5°C with search for Listeria M) - serologies according to context (rubella, toxoplasmosis, hepatitis, CMV, HIV, PB19) - Others according to signs of orientation: PCR (COVID), rapid influenza test, streto test, etc. - RCF and tocometry - obstetrical ultrasound: EPF, foetal well-being and amount of LA. properties.question: What is the primary purpose of performing a blood culture in a pregnant woman?
properties.option_a: To diagnose a urinary tract infection
properties.option_b: To identify the presence of Listeria M in the blood
properties.option_c: To detect the presence of HIV in the blood
properties.option_d: To monitor the fetal well-being during pregnancy
